text: I’ve mentioned before that I do have strategies where my closing bet does seem to be +EV for some reason. Not only that, in a way, it’s dependent on my opening bet because I’m staking based on what my opening position is (I haven’t actually tried working out how to stake without that opening bet). In the chart below opening is blue, closing is orange.

text: Does that come from people over copying your bets?

elements.text: Does that come from people over copying your bets?

text: That’s one possibility I’ve thought of. Some sort of “overbought or oversold” factor whereby me doing the closing counter bet becomes +EV. Otherwise I don’t understand it, because it doesn’t backtest like this.

elements.text: That’s one possibility I’ve thought of. Some sort of “overbought or oversold” factor whereby me doing the closing counter bet becomes +EV. Otherwise I don’t understand it, because it doesn’t backtest like this.

text: So the whole category of strategies where the second bet relies on the first bet which might even be -EV exists. Sort of market effect / manipulation type strategies.

elements.text: So the whole category of strategies where the second bet relies on the first bet which might even be -EV exists. Sort of market effect / manipulation type strategies.

text: Very interesting! I guess the point still stands that you only take on +EV bets, even though in this case there is a link from the opening.

elements.text: Very interesting! I guess the point still stands that you only take on +EV bets, even though in this case there is a link from the opening.

text: Is the entry a take order?

elements.text: Is the entry a take order?

text: Open is an offer.

elements.text: Open is an offer.

text: <@U01U24AG35W> People may have strategies to copy large orders as thats seen as a signal maybe. If too many people copy this strategy, it will lead to overbacking and create a +EV exit trade

text: I guess looking at the chart the blue line still could go negative?

elements.text: I guess looking at the chart the blue line still could go negative?

text: Ya, but over a year and many bets both have stayed positive now. Backtest says it should only be the open.

elements.text: Ya, but over a year and many bets both have stayed positive now. Backtest says it should only be the open.

text: I think it comes back to what you were talking about yesterday. I think anything fundamental tends to find higher value early, but no liquidity. But then low edge later when there is liquidity. My model isn’t good enough near the off yet.

elements.text: I think it comes back to what you were talking about yesterday. I think anything fundamental tends to find higher value early, but no liquidity. But then low edge later when there is liquidity. My model isn’t good enough near the off yet.

text: Then with offering I’m probably getting adverse selection which isn’t reflected in backtest. But taking early on the spread is too wide. And maybe I’m moving the market too which the backtest also doesn’t reflect.

elements.text: Then with offering I’m probably getting adverse selection which isn’t reflected in backtest. But taking early on the spread is too wide. And maybe I’m moving the market too which the backtest also doesn’t reflect.

text: Conclusion: I basically have to improve my model.

elements.text: Conclusion: I basically have to improve my model.

text: But it’s just an interesting case of close bet being +EV.

elements.text: But it’s just an interesting case of close bet being +EV.

text: just an AWS question here, do stopped instances incur charges? Can they be restarted with files intact?

text: you will be billed for the storage of the instance; if you terminate it then you will not be billed at all, but all the storage will get deleted
